item.title: From Latin America’s richest country 100 years ago to a founding member of OPEC, the long history of Venezuela’s oil and U.S. ties, explained
item.description: In the 1990s, Venezuelan society became further split between the wealthy, who wanted to work with the US, and the working class, who didn't.

item.title: When brands play hard to get: why you’re drawn to products that neg you
item.description: We call this “dissuasive framing.” Instead of saying a product is perfect for everyone, a company is up front about who it might not be for.

item.title: Amazon is cutting checks to millions of customers as part of a $2.5 billion FTC settlement. Here’s who qualifies and how to get paid
item.description: The $2.5 billion package ranks among the largest enforcement actions in the agency’s history.

item.title: Ray Dalio says AI is in ‘the early stages of a bubble,’ so watch out for 2026
item.description: After strong returns in U.S. markets last year, 2026 might be a different story.

item.title: Want AI agents to work better? Improve the way they retrieve information, Databricks says
item.description: Databricks is debuting a new system for retrieving the data that AI agents need to perform tasks accurately.
